name: unsoundness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of not being good enough, acceptable, or able to be trusted: The company's financial unsoundness had been hidden from the shareholders. The unsoundness of this assumption has already been pointed out. Opposite
soundness unsoundness of mind
law
  specialized the condition of being mentally ill: The judge accepted that the police had no knowledge of the defendant’s unsoundness of mind. Mental unsoundness insufficient to prevent a trial may still be sufficient to reduce the offence to a lower category.
More examplesFewer examplesHe befriended the man despite having concerns about his moral unsoundness.
